Evaluate the improper Riemann integral

∫0∞x2−1x2+1sin⁡xx dx.\int_0^\infty \frac{x^2 - 1}{x^2 + 1} \frac{\sin{x}}{x} \,\diff{x}.∫0∞​x2+1x2−1​xsinx​dx.

Justify all manipulations.
Solution.

Let f(z)=z2−1z2+1eizzf\p{z} = \frac{z^2 - 1}{z^2 + 1} \frac{e^{iz}}{z}f(z)=z2+1z2−1​zeiz​. For 0<ε<R0 < \epsilon < R0<ε<R, let γε,R\gamma_{\epsilon,R}γε,R​ be the contour

γε,R=[ε,R]∪{Reiθ | 0≤θ≤π}∪[−R,−ε]∪{εeiθ | 0≤θ≤π}\gamma_{\epsilon,R} = \br{\epsilon, R} \cup \set{Re^{i\theta} \st 0 \leq \theta \leq \pi} \cup \br{-R, -\epsilon} \cup \set{\epsilon e^{i\theta} \st 0 \leq \theta \leq \pi}γε,R​=[ε,R]∪{Reiθ∣∣​0≤θ≤π}∪[−R,−ε]∪{εeiθ∣∣​0≤θ≤π}

oriented counter-clockwise. On the large semi-circle CRC_RCR​, we have

∣∫CRf(z) dz∣≤∫0πR2+1R2−1e−Rsin⁡θ dθ=2(R2+1)R2−1∫0π/2e−Rsin⁡θ dθ≤2(R2+1)R2−1∫0π/2e−2Rθ/π dθ=π(R2+1)R(R2−1)(1−e−R)→R→∞0.\begin{aligned} \abs{\int_{C_R} f\p{z} \,\diff{z}} &\leq \int_0^\pi \frac{R^2 + 1}{R^2 - 1} e^{-R\sin\theta} \,\diff\theta \\ &= \frac{2\p{R^2 + 1}}{R^2 - 1} \int_0^{\pi/2} e^{-R\sin\theta} \,\diff\theta \\ &\leq \frac{2\p{R^2 + 1}}{R^2 - 1} \int_0^{\pi/2} e^{-2R\theta/\pi} \,\diff\theta \\ &= \frac{\pi\p{R^2 + 1}}{R\p{R^2 - 1}} \p{1 - e^{-R}} \xrightarrow{R\to\infty} 0. \end{aligned}∣∣​∫CR​​f(z)dz∣∣​​≤∫0π​R2−1R2+1​e−Rsinθdθ=R2−12(R2+1)​∫0π/2​e−Rsinθdθ≤R2−12(R2+1)​∫0π/2​e−2Rθ/πdθ=R(R2−1)π(R2+1)​(1−e−R)R→∞​0.​

On CεC_\epsilonCε​, we get a half residue in the limit: Notice that f(z)+1zf\p{z} + \frac{1}{z}f(z)+z1​ is holomorphic near z=0z = 0z=0 since fff has residue −1-1−1 there, so it is bounded near z=0z = 0z=0 by some M>0M > 0M>0. Hence,

∣∫Cεf(z)+1z dz∣≤M∣Cε∣→ε→00  ⟹  lim⁡ε→0∫Cεf(z) dz=πi.\begin{gathered} \abs{\int_{C_\epsilon} f\p{z} + \frac{1}{z} \,\diff{z}} \leq M\abs{C_\epsilon} \xrightarrow{\epsilon\to0} 0 \\ \implies \lim_{\epsilon\to0} \int_{C_\epsilon} f\p{z} \,\diff{z} = \pi i. \end{gathered}∣∣​∫Cε​​f(z)+z1​dz∣∣​≤M∣Cε​∣ε→0​0⟹ε→0lim​∫Cε​​f(z)dz=πi.​

Finally, our γε,R\gamma_{\epsilon,R}γε,R​ contains a pole at z=iz = iz=i, which gives the residue

Res⁡(f;i)=lim⁡z→i (z−i)f(z)=lim⁡z→iz2−1z+ieizz=e−1.\Res{f}{i} = \lim_{z\to i} \,\p{z - i}f\p{z} = \lim_{z\to i} \frac{z^2 - 1}{z + i} \frac{e^{iz}}{z} = e^{-1}.Res(f;i)=z→ilim​(z−i)f(z)=z→ilim​z+iz2−1​zeiz​=e−1.

Thus, by the residue theorem, sending ε→0\epsilon \to 0ε→0 and R→∞R \to \inftyR→∞, we get

∫−∞∞x2−1x2+1eixx dx=2πie−1−πi.\int_{-\infty}^\infty \frac{x^2 - 1}{x^2 + 1} \frac{e^{ix}}{x} \,\diff{x} = 2\pi i e^{-1} - \pi i.∫−∞∞​x2+1x2−1​xeix​dx=2πie−1−πi.

Taking imaginary parts and noting that the integrand is even, we have

∫0∞x2−1x2+1sin⁡xx dx=πe−π2.\int_0^\infty \frac{x^2 - 1}{x^2 + 1} \frac{\sin{x}}{x} \,\diff{x} = \frac{\pi}{e} - \frac{\pi}{2}.∫0∞​x2+1x2−1​xsinx​dx=eπ​−2π​.
